opendial.gui

Class GUIFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.gui.GUIFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public class GUIFrame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
    Main GUI frame for the OpenDial toolkit, encompassing various tabs and menus to control the application
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-02-04 09:51:48 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      GUIFrame(DialogueSystem system)

      • trigger

        public void trigger(DialogueState state,
           java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> updatedVars)
        Updates the current dialogue state displayed in the component. The current dialogue state is name "current" in the selection list.
        Specified by:
        trigger in interface Module
        Parameters:
        state - the dialogue state
        updatedVars - the set of updated variables

      • recordState

        public void recordState(DialogueState state,
               java.lang.String name)
        Records a dialogue state in the component and makes it available for display in the network selection list on the left side. The network is associated with a specific name. If the name already exists, the previous network is erased.
        Parameters:
        state - the dialogue state to record
        name - the name for the recorded network
